channel.title: Simpleton - A Mess In Progress!
channel.description:
[center][size=24pt][i]Simpleton[/i][/size]
-This page is still in progress and will be finished with the layout by tonight. I currently have things to do IRL that are far more important at the moment but I'll leave you with a picture.. (I'm still in progress with editing the graphics.. I'd like to get into slightly more detail before I can say I'm happy with them.)
[img]http://i.imgur.com/CIWMb.png[/img][/center]
UPDATE 5/16/12 Was muted until recently, will update thread tonight with progress.

item.title: Simpleton - A Mess In Progress!
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

Lin:

Please read http://gamedev.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,533202.0.html. I’m sorry but… That entire screenshot just looks horrible… Pokemon Advance graphics with poorly drawn graphics slapped on there and detailed unfitting graphics from who knows what. No offense, but it’s just… really bad I have a strong feeling you’re lying about drawing everything but the blue bars. And even so, all 3 bars together take up an area of 13524 pixels, which is 18.78463782207097715119105493437% of the picture. Not 1%.

Yeah the grass is something I didn’t draw that came frame the pokemon game or whatever, actually completely forgot to mention that.
When I said 1% I didn’t mean for people to get extremely statistical about it I just meant I hadn’t drawn those lol.
Thanks for the guide though I’m definitely going to attempt to follow it as best as I can, I’m extremely new to this whole ordeal.
What would you suggest the inventory,chat box and all that look like? I’d kind of like to keep the grass because everything else I painted and slapped in there was pretty awful looking but I guess I’ll get to changing those now and the shape of the game frame as well has extreme issues.

edit - pretty much completely changed the frame and layout of the game.
In my opinion looks much more appealing - I’m trying to go with a more simple outlook for the game.
Now to get things to actually work correctly…

Read full topic
